data.title: Check in of Single solution projects
data.body:
Check in of Single solution projects - from develop branch only, no changes reqd
- vs solution - MonoGame.Framework.sln - Manages all windows based solutions
- Xamarin solution - MonoGame.Framework.Xamarin.sln - Manages all solutions supported by Xamarin Studio (Needs Trial or Ent license to build)

data.title: Replacing Serializable attributes to DataContract attributes for all platforms
data.body:
Changed the Serialization attributes on all files employing them to new DataContract Attributes including enabling the DataMember attributes where existing (no new additions, although these should be reviewed where ever DataContract is used)

Also updated project files to include the System.Runtime.Serialisation namespace if not already existing as this is needed to reference the DataContract Attribute

data.title: Touch input support on Windows
data.body:
Added handling for the windows procedures:  WM_POINTERUP, WP_POINTERDOWN, WM_POINTERUPDATE.

These are parsed in to TouchLocations and added to the TouchPanel.

data.title: ComputeShader for MonoGame !
WP8 TouchPanel hacking removed
data.body:
Until now, touchpanel display size was set to the client size instead of the resolution (and the GraphicsDeviceManager's ApplyChanges wasn't called so it won't be changed back to the resolution). With the window size scaling applied, this is no longer needed.

Update: removed the pointless scale of client size. Tested on all resolutions.

data.title: Yet to be implemented
data.body:
- RenderTarget3D (https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/1549) - needs implementation on Mac, Linux, WinGL, iOS, Android, Win8, PSMobile, WinPhone
- Multiple Window support (https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/1465) - needs implementation on Mac, Linux, WinGL
- Window.IsBorderless (https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/1389) - needs implementation on Mac
- [DONE] Fullscreen Support - needs implementation on WinDX

Just a idea, might be easier for maintenance. Please edit for anything that's missing.

data.title: MediaPlayer app resume support on WP8
data.body:
Restore MediaPlayer song and position after resume on WP8
Removed leftover WP8 code

data.title: Activated and Deactivated events on WP8
data.body: WP8 has so many limitations that this was the only nice way to get it working.

data.title: Cannot open iOS projects using Xamarin VS integration
data.body:
If I try and open the iOS project I get greeted with an error regarding the platform imports:
"The imported project "C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\MonoTouch\Novell.MonoTouch.Common.targets" was not found. Confirm that the path in the <Import> declaration is correct, and that the file exists on disk."

I resolved this last time by updating the imports to the Xamarin version

Would this be an acceptable change to make or is there a way to get the above imports on windows, or a dual build way?

data.title: Fixes disappearing SoundEffects on iOS
data.body:
Fixes disappearing SoundEffects on iOS (#1123)
This is accomplished by manually setting the buffer properties if the packet does not decode (MonoTouch bug)

Fixed broken sound buffer debug output

data.title: Fixed Guide exception on WP8
data.body:
Fixed initialization exception when Guide is called on WP8 from non-UI thread

Tested on Windows 8 and WP8.

data.title: GetRenderTargets/SetRenderTargets
Some misc changes for the WP8 XamlGame
data.body: Title says it all :)

data.title: new RasterizerState(...)
data.body:
Hello,

its not an Issue but a difference between XNA and Monogame.
I translated my XNA WP7-Project to MonoGame for Android and I
had a few new RasterizerState() Initializations in a Draw-Method.
Thats bad. I know, now ;) But, on WP7 it works correctly and on
MonoGame on Android, after a few Seconds, the framerate goes down.
From 41 to 3 FPS. The GC worked and worked.

I think, in XNA, there will be a few preinstanced RasterizerState-Instances.
So, it feels like a Struct.

Maybe, it could be good to use the same mechanism for the MonoGame-Lib.

bye,
Ronny

data.title: Cancel Guide.BeginShowKeyboardInput on iOS.
data.body:
Does it make sense to be able to close the Guide using the KeyboardInputAsyncResult? I ask this because I kind of need to do this... I'm thinking about making a PR with this functionality, but I'm not sure if what I want is OK with the MonoGame guidelines. On XNA you can't do this, at least I think you can't... so this would be an extra functionality.
Basically I would only add a method "void CancelAsync();" to the KeyboardInputAsyncResult class. Internally I would only call "ViewController_InputCanceled(null, EventArgs.Empty);" and that is it.
I ask this only because I don't know if it would be accepted as a PR.

What do you guys think?

data.title: Song is not yet implemented ?
data.body: I have issue with Song class. It cannot load mp3 ,ogg or wav files through Content and if can(xnb)  it will not playing with MediaPlayer.Play. Tested both on WindowsGL and WinRT. Is it intended ? (I downloaded lastest git and compile but confront with the same problem). Whats the instruction for Song class usage ?

data.title: Added MGSpriteFontTextureProcessor content processor.
data.body:
This allows MG to compile images to SpriteFonts, using the params like
in XNA. This was just an adaption from the MGSpriteFontProcessor, so the
problems that MGSpriteFontProcessor has, MGSpriteFontTextureProcessor
will also have.

data.title: iOS SaveAsPng and SaveAsJpeg
data.body: These are not implemented in the develop3d branch or the master branch.  I believe that at some point this was implemented in the develop branch but it is not there now.

data.title: GamePad: mappings incorrect for OSX and Xbox 360 controller
WP DrawingSurface & Resume
data.body:
Notes:
- added support for rendering to DrawingSurface (http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/435425, http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/432138, http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/403764)
- fixed problem with Game.Dispose and than recreating Game object (http://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/435932)
- fixed resume on Windows Phone (#1471)

When adding support for rendering to DrawingSurface, a new parameter was introduced to XamlGame.Create:

static public T Create(string launchParameters, PhoneApplicationPage page, UIElement drawingSurface = null)

Default value is added so any existing code will work as it did before; however one can manually specify on which surface to draw, currently drawing surface can be either DrawingSurfaceBackgroundGrid or DrawingSurface. Please feel free to comment/change this change to XamlGame.Create. This is the only public API change, other stuff is internal. One can use same approach as for MediaElement, that is to search for DrawingSurfaceBackgroundGrid or DrawingSurface within UI tree and ditch the third parameter from Create.

EDIT:
Due Nezz@6ed2156 we eliminated the third parameter from Create so Create method stays the same.

data.title: Developsinglesolution
data.body:
Single solution PR providing a single Windows solution for windows projects and an additional solution for Xamarin Studio

*Note1
Currently has a dependency on the split "core" pull request for the windows solution

*Note2
The Linux Lidgren project has the same GUID as another Lidgren project and causes Xamarin Studio to exclude it on open, until this is resolved a simple workaround is to re-add the project after opening which works fine for builds

*Note3
Due to limitations with Xamarin studio licensing, the Android and iOS projects have been left out of VS as these require an enterprise license, also projects can only be built individually within Xamarin studio using the free license but still open / work fine

data.title: Vector2,3,4.cs - Creating (allocating) new Vectors when probably shouldn't, in ref/out versions of some operations
data.body: Some ref/out versions of operations (meant to be used for a little extra performance), such as Add, simply assign to the 'out' result's members directly (which is how 'out' results should be assigned to since they're value types). Others, such as Barycentric, call new Vectorx() for the 'out' result. The ref/out versions of the operations are meant for performance, and unnecessarily calling new Vectorx() then a copy to the result, both takes (a little) longer, and could impact memory usage and garbage collection. The ref/out versions of the operations should be updated to not use new Vectorx(), but simply assign directly to the out result members..

data.title: Missing Song.FromUri
data.body: There is no FromUri in the Android Song implementation.
